slots.name: hero
slots.description: Accepts a hero image to display at the top of the dialog

slots.name: heading
slots.description: Acts as the heading of the dialog. This should be an actual heading tag `<h1-6 />`
Content not addressed to a specific slot will be interpreted as the main content of the dialog

slots.name: footer
slots.description: Content addressed to the `footer` will be placed below the main content and to the side of any `[slot='button']` content

slots.name: button
slots.description: Button elements addressed to this slot may be placed below the content when not delivered in a fullscreen mode

attributes.name: dropEffect
attributes.description: Controls the feedback (typically visual) the user is given during a drag and drop operation

properties.name: dropEffect
properties.description: Controls the feedback (typically visual) the user is given during a drag and drop operation

events.name: sp-dropzone-should-accept
events.description:
A cancellable event that confirms whether or not
a file dropped on the UI should be accepted.

events.name: sp-dropzone-dragover
events.description: Announces when files have been dragged over the UI, but not yet dropped.

events.name: sp-dropzone-dragleave
events.description: Announces when dragged files have been moved out of the UI without having been dropped.

events.name: sp-dropzone-drop
events.description: Announces when dragged files have been dropped on the UI.

slots.description:
The default slot on an `sp-dropzone` is a great place to place upload instructions
built with an `sp-illustrated-message` or other information, possibly even built from data
provided by the upload, to support users successfully interacting with the drag and drop
based features of your application
